Class TaskAssigner

  • java.lang.Object
    • TaskAssigner

  • public class TaskAssigner
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can be use to assign tasks to people. Two files are needed: The file with the tasks and the file with the people to assign the tasks. The program will write a file with the tasks assigned to people in one file named "assigned.txt".
    Author:
    ivan

      • assign

        public static void assign(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks,
                          java.util.ArrayList<Person> people)
        This method assign tasks to people. Two options are available:
        • The size of the tasks list is less or equal than the size of the people list.
        • The size of the tasks list is greater than the size of the people list. In this case, other two options are available:
          • Each person have the same number of tasks.
          • Some people have more tasks than other.
          Parameters:
          tasks - List of tasks.
          people - List of people.

        • remainderZero

          public static void remainderZero(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<Person> people,
                                 double taskPerPerson)
          This method can be used when the size of the tasks list is less or equal than the size of the people list.
          Parameters:
          tasks - List of tasks.
          people - List of people.

        • tasksLessOrEqualThanPeople

          public static java.util.ArrayList<Person> tasksLessOrEqualThanPeople(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks,
                                                                     java.util.ArrayList<Person> people)
          This method can be used when each person have the same number of tasks.
          Parameters:
          tasks - List of tasks.
          people - List of people.
          taskPerPerson - tasksList.size() / peopleList.size().
